predicate.note: Frames file for 'carve' based on sentences in wsj and automatic expansion via verbnet.

example.name: all args
example.text: John carved the delicate vegetables with a chainsaw.

example.name: with other args
example.text: John carved the block of ice into a swan.

example.name: order reversed
example.text: John carved a swan out of a block of ice.

example.name: just transitive
example.text: No federal court has ruled that the Voting Rights Act protects a white minority, but in June the Justice Department approved a districting plan for Birmingham that *trace* carves out three white-majority districts and six black-majority districts.
example.arg: three white-majority districts and six black-majority districts

example.name: with benefactive
example.text: The unusual situation in Birmingham vividly illustrates the divisive consequences of *trace* carving out safe districts for racial minorities.

example.name: odd way to phrase start state/material
example.text: But their ideal of an Afrikaner homeland, an all-white reserve *trace* *trace* to be carved *trace* out of present-day South Africa, is a mainstream desire of the right-wing, which embraces about one-third of the country's five million whites.

example.name: odd way to phrase end state
example.text: But that has been the key to Compaq's success, he adds, whereas Dell carved out its market niche as a direct seller of low-cost but reliable computers -- and it might be too late in the game for a shift in strategy.
example.arg: a direct seller of low-cost but reliable computers
